title: Medication
description: An order or request for both supply of the medication and the instructions for administration of the medication to a patient.(Based on HL7 FHIR Release 5 specifications)

fhir:identifier.title: Identifier
fhir:identifier.description: Identifiers associated with this medication request that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate.

fhir:basedOn.title: Based On
fhir:basedOn.description: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this medication request.

fhir:priorPrescription.title: Prior Prescription
fhir:priorPrescription.description: Reference to an order/prescription that is being replaced by this MedicationRequest.

fhir:groupIdentifier.title: Group Identifier
fhir:groupIdentifier.description: A shared identifier common to multiple independent Request instances that were activated/authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author.

fhir:status.title: Status
fhir:status.description: preparation | in-progress | cancelled | on-hold | completed | entered-in-error | stopped | declined | unknown

fhir:statusReason.title: Status Reason
fhir:statusReason.description: Captures the reason for the current state of the MedicationRequest.

fhir:statusChanged.title: Status Changed
fhir:statusChanged.description: The date (and perhaps time) when the status was changed.

fhir:intent.title: Intent
fhir:intent.description: proposal | plan | order | original-order | reflex-order | filler-order | instance-order | option

fhir:category.title: Category
fhir:category.description: An arbitrary categorization or grouping of the medication request. It could be used for indicating where meds are intended to be administered, eg. in an inpatient setting or in a patient's home, or a legal category of the medication.

fhr:doNotPerform.title: Do Not Perform
fhr:doNotPerform.description: True if patient is to stop taking or not to start taking the medication.

fhir:medication.title: Medication
fhir:medication.description: Identifies the medication being requested. This is a link to a resource that represents the medication which may be the details of the medication or simply an attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

fhir:subject.title: Subject
fhir:subject.description: The individual or group for whom the medication has been requested.

fhir:informationSource.title: Information Source
fhir:informationSource.description: The person or organization who provided the information about this request, if the source is someone other than the requestor. This is often used when the MedicationRequest is reported by another person.

fhir:encounter.title: Encounter
fhir:encounter.description: The Encounter during which this request was created.

fhir:supportingInformation.title: Supporting Information
fhir:supportingInformation.description: Information to support fulfilling (i.e. dispensing or administering) of the medication, for example, patient height and weight, a MedicationStatement for the patient).

fhir:authoredOn.title: Authored On
fhir:authoredOn.description: The date (and perhaps time) when the prescription was initially written or authored on.

fhir:requester.title: Requester
fhir:requester.description: The individual, organization, or device that initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.

fhr:reported.title: Reported
fhr:reported.description: Indicates if this record was captured as a secondary 'reported' record rather than as an original primary source-of-truth record. It may also indicate the source of the report.

fhir:performerType.title: Performer Type
fhir:performerType.description: Indicates the type of performer of the administration of the medication.

fhir:performer.title: Performer
fhir:performer.description: The specified desired performer of the medication treatment (e.g. the performer of the medication administration). For devices, this is the device that is intended to perform the administration of the medication.

fhir:device.title: Device
fhir:device.description: The intended type of device that is to be used for the administration of the medication (for example, PCA Pump).

fhir:recorder.title: Recorder
fhir:recorder.description: The person who entered the order on behalf of another individual for example in the case of a verbal or a telephone order.

fhir:reason.title: Reason
fhir:reason.description: The reason or the indication for ordering or not ordering the medication.

fhir:courseOfTherapyType.title: Course Of Therapy Type
fhir:courseOfTherapyType.description: The description of the overall pattern of the administration of the medication to the patient.

fhir:insurance.title: Insurance
fhir:insurance.description: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be required for delivering the requested service.

fhir:note.title: Note
fhir:note.description: Extra information about the prescription that could not be conveyed by the other attributes.

fhir:renderedDosageInstruction.title: Rendered Dosage Instruction
fhir:renderedDosageInstruction.description: The full representation of the dose of the medication included in all dosage instructions. To be used when multiple dosage instructions are included to represent complex dosing such as increasing or tapering doses.

fhir:effectiveDosePeriod.title: Effective Dose Period
fhir:effectiveDosePeriod.description: The period over which the medication is to be taken. Where there are multiple dosageInstruction lines (for example, tapering doses), this is the earliest date and the latest end date of the dosageInstructions.

fhir:dosageInstruction.title: Dosage Instruction
fhir:dosageInstruction.description: Specific instructions for how the medication is to be used by the patient.

fhir:dispenseRequest.title: Dispense Request
fhir:dispenseRequest.description: Indicates the specific details for the dispense or medication supply part of a medication request (also known as a Medication Prescription or Medication Order).

xdm:quantity.title: quantity
xdm:quantity.description: The amount or quantity to provide as part of the first dispense.

xdm:duration.title: Duration
xdm:duration.description: The length of time that the first dispense is expected to last.

xdm:dispenseInterval.title: Dispense Interval
xdm:dispenseInterval.description: The minimum period of time that must occur between dispenses of the medication.

xdm:validityPeriod.title: Validity Period
xdm:validityPeriod.description: This indicates the validity period of a prescription (stale dating the Prescription).

xdm:quantity.title: quantity
xdm:quantity.description: The amount that is to be dispensed for one fill.

xdm:expectedSupplyDuration.title: Expected Supply Duration
xdm:expectedSupplyDuration.description: Identifies the period time over which the supplied product is expected to be used, or the length of time the dispense is expected to last.

xdm:dispenser.title: Dispenser
xdm:dispenser.description: Indicates the intended performing Organization that will dispense the medication as specified by the prescriber.

xdm:dispenserInstruction.title: Dispenser Instruction
xdm:dispenserInstruction.description: Provides additional information to the dispenser, for example, counselling to be provided to the patient.

xdm:doseAdministrationAid.title: Dose Administration Aid
xdm:doseAdministrationAid.description: Provides information about the type of adherence packaging to be supplied for the medication dispense.

fhir:substitution.title: Substitution
fhir:substitution.description: Indicates whether or not substitution can or should be part of the dispense. In some cases, substitution must happen, in other cases substitution must not happen.

xdm:allowedBoolean.title: Allowed Boolean
xdm:allowedBoolean.description: True if the prescriber allows a different drug to be dispensed from what was prescribed.

xdm:allowedCodeableConcept.title: Allowed Codeable Concept
xdm:allowedCodeableConcept.description: Code if the prescriber allows a different drug to be dispensed from what was prescribed.

xdm:reason.title: Reason
xdm:reason.description: Indicates the reason for the substitution, or why substitution must or must not be performed.

fhir:eventHistory.title: Event History
fhir:eventHistory.description: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this resource or fulfilling request or event resources that identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the resource.
